Woodland.Gibson Mansion:
The Gibson Mansion (also known as the Yolo County Historical Museum, YCHM, the Gibson House, or the Gibson Museum) is a historic mansion that now serves as a museum in Woodland, California. Exemplifying several architectural styles, including Georgian Revival and Neoclassical, it is listed in the National Register of Historic Places.


== History ==
William Byas Gibson (1831-1906), originally from Virginia, moved from Missouri to Yolo County in 1850 and began to farm and raise livestock.
